final_answer.precision_note: All bond energies provided to 3 significant figures; subtraction preserves that precision level for estimated enthalpy.

method: Use the bond-energy estimate formula \DeltaH = sum(bonds broken) - sum(bonds formed). For CH4 + 2O2, broken bonds are 4 C-H at 413 kJ mol^-1 and 2 O=O at 498 kJ mol^-1: E_broken = 4(413)+2(498)=2648 kJ mol^-1. Formed bonds are in CO2 (2 C=O at 805 each) and 2H2O (4 O-H at 463 each): E_formed = 2(805)+4(463)=3462 kJ mol^-1. Therefore \DeltaH = 2648 - 3462 = -814 kJ mol^-1.
checks: Reaction has 4 C-H and 2 O=O bonds broken, matching reactants CH4 and 2O2.
Products contain 2 C=O and 4 O-H bonds, matching CO2 and 2H2O formation.
Negative sign is expected for a combustion reaction and indicates heat released.
